lexUnit.name: wag.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (especially with reference to an animal's tail) move rapidly to and fro.

sentence.text: The assassination of JFK might have started the process on its own , but certainly the assassination of the assassin , while he was in police custody , set tongues wagging here and there .
An event that made heads turn and tongues wag .
This is a small island and tongues are beginning to wag .
Now the tongues would start wagging round MI5 , MI6 and the other , smaller Intelligence Agencies .
Erika wagged a finger .
Matron was about to answer when Tock wagged a bony finger at them .
He shouted and wagged his finger .
Wagging a finger in the air , he marched out of the railway station , followed by Fouchard and his men .
He wagged a playfully warning finger in her direction .
The second man smiles , wags his index finger and picks up a copy of his company 's annual report .
She wagged a playfully admonishing finger towards the audience .
Uncle Alfred wagged his head slowly .
She wagged her head from side to side .
He wagged his head to the music and his turban slipped over one eye .
He pursed his lips and wagged his head .
She poked about in the brambles and wagged her tail .
When Wexford got home for his tea Clytemnestra wagged her darning-wool tail at him but she did n't get out of his chair .
Progress was painfully slow ; I had owned her for a year before she wagged her tail at me .
Bully wagged his tail , but he was n't really listening .
The dog moved off a few paces and turned back , wagging his tail anxiously .
It wagged its tail in excitement at the presence of so many people .
Hector , waking abruptly , looked up and set up a joyous barking , leaping to his feet and wagging a curly tail .
He was grinning , in a fatherly sort of way , and wagging his hands at Elinor .

The possession of large machines by those responsible for managing rivers can sometimes lead to a situation where the tail wags the dog , and the results can be damaging to both the environment and the economy .
It stuck tiny thumbs in small ears , wagged its fingers , and put out its tongue .
Piper wagged his hand up and down like a broken automaton .
Then two of the Koi and a couple of Orfe began to have problems swimming and were wagging their heads and going backwards .
Some owners have claimed that their Cornish Rex cats wag their tails when pleased , like dogs , although this is hard to believe .
Mrs Hobden went down on her knees and stroked her gently , and as Sandy 's tail wagged feebly at her touch she burst into tears .
Domino , their elderly Dalmation , rushed to meet her , tail wagging with excitement .
Racing back into the hall with tails wagging furiously , they almost knocked Georgina over .
Her gorgeous tail curls right up over her back and wags incessantly .
They stood round in a ring long after she 'd come to rest , after her legs had stopped wagging , after her fingers had stopped tugging .
He sat there with his leg wagging
She poked about in the brambles and wagged her tail .
Bully wagged his tail on seeing Angela , but Angela did n't pat him .
One whiff of the opened container will make an on-heat goat wag her tail in the characteristic manner .
Instead of taking to her heels , as any sensible pariah dog would have done , she advanced wagging her tail to sniff at him .
